jodd.servlet

Class SessionMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • jodd.servlet.SessionMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javax.servlet.http.HttpSessionListener

    public class SessionMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.servlet.http.HttpSessionListener
    Session monitor keep map of sessions and allow registration of session listeners in runtime.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<javax.servlet.http.HttpSessionListener> listeners 
      protected java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.String,javax.servlet.http.HttpSession> sessionMap 
      protected static SessionMonitor sessionMonitor

      SessionMonitor()
      Creates new session monitor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Destroys this session monitor by removing all collected resources.
      static SessionMonitor getInstance()
      Returns singleton instance of SessionMonitor.
      javax.servlet.http.HttpSession getSession(java.lang.String sessionId)
      Returns session for given session id.
      java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> iterator()
      Returns iterator for all stored session IDs.
      void registerListener(javax.servlet.http.HttpSessionListener listener)
      Registers new session listener.
      void removeListener(javax.servlet.http.HttpSessionListener listener)
      Removes existing session listener.
      void sessionCreated(javax.servlet.http.HttpSessionEvent httpSessionEvent)
      Stores session in map and broadcasts event to registered listeners.
      void sessionDestroyed(javax.servlet.http.HttpSessionEvent httpSessionEvent)
      Removes session from a map and broadcasts event to registered listeners.

      • getSession

        public javax.servlet.http.HttpSession getSession(java.lang.String sessionId)
        Returns session for given session id. Returns null if session expired.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> iterator()
        Returns iterator for all stored session IDs. Keep in mind that session may NOT longer exist during the iteration!

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this session monitor by removing all collected resources.
